message.content:
cs.SI, cs.LG, cs.SD, cs.IR, cs.DS 

The paper presents a novel approach for learning multiscale representations of vertices in a network, which is a common problem in social network analysis and machine learning. The paper uses random walks on the vertices of a graph to generate multiscale relationships, which can then be used to learn a series of latent representations. This approach is relevant to several sub-categories of computer science, including social networks (cs.SI), machine learning (cs.LG), data structures and algorithms (cs.DS), information retrieval (cs.IR), and statistical learning (cs.SD).
